definitions.definition: possession of the qualities (especially mental qualities) required to do something or get something done
the quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment
pretend to have certain qualities or state of mind
behave unnaturally or affectedly
something that people do or cause to happen
a legal document codifying the result of deliberations of a committee or society or legislative body
perform an action, or work out or perform (an action)
examples: The governor should act on the new energy bill
The nanny acted quickly by grabbing the toddler and covering him with a wet towel

definitions.definition: a short performance that is part of a longer program
examples: he did his act three times every evening

definitions.definition: perform on a stage or theater
have an effect or outcome; often the one desired or expected
examples: How does your idea work in practice?
The breaks of my new car act quickly

definitions.definition: behave in a certain manner; show a certain behavior; conduct or comport oneself
examples: You should act like an adult
The dog acts ferocious, but he is really afraid of people

definitions.definition: play a role or part
examples: She wants to act Lady Macbeth, but she is too young for the role

definitions.definition: a manifestation of insincerity
examples: he put on quite an act for her benefit

definitions.definition: a subdivision of a play or opera or ballet
be engaged in an activity, often for no particular purpose other than pleasure
be suitable for theatrical performance
discharge one's duties
examples: In what capacity are you acting?

definitions.definition: A particle which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
in the interval
examples: dancing all the dances with little rest between

definitions.definition: in between
examples: two houses with a tree between

definitions.definition: in reserve; not for immediate use
examples: put something by for her old age

definitions.definition: so as to pass a given point
describe or portray the character or the qualities or peculiarities of
be characteristic of
the process of bringing ideas or events together in memory or imagination
shifting from one form of transportation to another
examples: the plane was late and he missed his connection in Atlanta

definitions.definition: a relation between things or events (as in the case of one causing the other or sharing features with it)
examples: there was a connection between eating that pickle and having that nightmare

definitions.definition: an instrumentality that connects
the act of bringing two things into contact (especially for communication)
examples: there was a connection via the internet

definitions.definition: the state of being connected
examples: the connection between church and state is inescapable

definitions.definition: a connecting shape
a supplier (especially of narcotics)
(usually plural) a person who is influential and to whom you are connected in some way (as by family or friendship)
the ability to create
any process serving to define the shape of something
show the form or outline of
examples: The tree was clearly defined by the light
The camera could define the smallest object

definitions.definition: decide upon or fix definitely
determine the essential quality of
determine the nature of
give a definition for the meaning of a word
the act of discovering something
come upon, as if by accident; meet with
examples: We find this idea in Plato

definitions.definition: discover or determine the existence, presence, or fact of
come to believe on the basis of emotion, intuitions, or indefinite grounds
examples: I find him to be obnoxious

definitions.definition: perceive or be contemporaneous with
get or find back; recover the use of
accept and make use of one's personality, abilities, and situation
examples: My son went to Berkeley to find himself

definitions.definition: make a discovery
receive a specified treatment (abstract)
examples: These aspects of civilization do not find expression or receive an interpretation

definitions.definition: a productive insight
establish after a calculation, investigation, experiment, survey, or study
examples: find the product of two numbers

definitions.definition: make a discovery, make a new finding
get something or somebody for a specific purpose
decide on and make a declaration about
come upon after searching; find the location of something that was missed or lost
obtain through effort or management
perceive oneself to be in a certain condition or place
succeed in reaching; arrive at
make (offspring) by reproduction
bring into existence
examples: The new manager generated a lot of problems
The computer bug generated chaos in the office

definitions.definition: give or supply
produce (energy)
examples: We can't generate enough power for the entire city
The hydroelectric plant needs to generate more electricity

definitions.definition: not accessible to view
designed to elude detection
examples: a hidden room or place of concealment such as a priest hole

definitions.definition: difficult to find
(music) melodic subject of a musical composition
examples: the accompanist picked up the idea and elaborated it

definitions.definition: an approximate calculation of quantity or degree or worth
examples: a rough idea how long it would take

definitions.definition: the content of cognition; the main thing you are thinking about
examples: it was not a good idea

definitions.definition: your intention; what you intend to do
examples: the idea of the game is to capture all the pieces

definitions.definition: a personal view
examples: he has an idea that we don't like him

definitions.definition: (used of persons or artifacts) marked by independence and creativity in thought or action
a state in midwestern United States
to or toward the inside of
a unit of length equal to one twelfth of a foot
inRegion: united kingdom of great britain and northern ireland

definitions.definition: a rare soft silvery metallic element; occurs in small quantities in sphalerite
currently fashionable
directed or bound inward
holding office
a creation (a new device or process) resulting from study and experimentation
the creation of something in the mind
the act of starting something for the first time; introducing something new
To the inside of; within. It is used in a variety of applications.
have as a necessary feature
connect closely and often incriminatingly
require as useful, just, or proper
contain as a part
examples: Dinner at Joe's always involves at least six courses

definitions.definition: engage as a participant
examples: Don't involve me in your family affairs!

definitions.definition: make complex or intricate or complicated
occupy or engage the interest of
examples: His story completely involved me during the entire afternoon

definitions.definition: be priced at
represent, as of a character on stage
form or compose
be identical or equivalent to
have life, be alive
a light strong brittle grey toxic bivalent metallic element
have an existence, be extant
work in a specific place, with a specific subject, or in a specific function
have the quality of being; (copula, used with an adjective or a predicate noun)
occupy a certain position or area; be somewhere
spend or use time
to remain unmolested, undisturbed, or uninterrupted -- used only in infinitive form
put in order or neaten
eliminate urine
have a bowel movement
institute, enact, or establish
create by artistic means
make by combining materials and parts
give certain properties to something
examples: Don't make this into a big deal
This invention will make you a millionaire

definitions.definition: create or design, often in a certain way
charge with a function; charge to be
induce to have sex
head into a specified direction
achieve a point or goal
earn on some commercial or business transaction; earn as salary or wages
examples: How much do you make a month in your new job?

definitions.definition: represent fictitiously, as in a play, or pretend to be or act like
proceed along a path
examples: make one's way into the forest

definitions.definition: the act of mixing cards haphazardly
reach a goal
examples: She may not make the grade

definitions.definition: organize or be responsible for
examples: have, throw, or make a party

definitions.definition: give rise to; cause to happen or occur, not always intentionally
make, formulate, or derive in the mind
examples: What do you make of his remarks?

definitions.definition: reach a destination, either real or abstract
engage in
cause to do; cause to act in a specified manner
prepare for eating by applying heat
examples: can you make me an omelette?

definitions.definition: a recognizable kind
examples: what make of car is that?

definitions.definition: to compose or represent
make or cause to be or to become
examples: make a mess in one's office

definitions.definition: create or manufacture a man-made product
act in a certain way so as to acquire
add up to
amount to
examples: This salary increase makes no difference to my standard of living

definitions.definition: appear to begin an activity
assure the success of
examples: A good review by this critic will make your play!

definitions.definition: behave in a certain way
be or be capable of being changed or made into
examples: He will make a fine father

definitions.definition: be suitable for
calculate as being
examples: I make the height about 100 feet

definitions.definition: carry out or commit
cause to be enjoyable or pleasurable
change from one form into another
compel or make somebody or something to act in a certain way
consider as being
constitute the essence of
develop into
examples: He will make a splendid father!

definitions.definition: favor the development of
form by assembling individuals or constituents
gather and light the materials for
make by shaping or bringing together constituents
perform or carry out
reach in time
undergo fabrication or creation
examples: This wool makes into a nice sweater

definitions.definition: original and of a kind not seen before
(of crops) harvested at an early stage of development; before complete maturity
used of a living language; being the current stage in its development
lacking training or experience
examples: the new men were eager to fight

definitions.definition: having no previous example or precedent or parallel
very recently
examples: grass new washed by the rain

definitions.definition: in use after medieval times
not of long duration; having just (or relatively recently) come into being or been made or acquired or discovered
(often followed by `to') unfamiliar
examples: errors of someone new to the job

definitions.definition: other than the former one(s); different
examples: they now have a new leaders
my new car is four years old but has only 15,000 miles on it
ready to take a new direction

definitions.definition: unaffected by use or exposure
In a general sense, from, or out from; proceeding from; belonging to; relating to; concerning; -- used in a variety of applications.
a customary way of operation or behavior
a perceptual structure
examples: a visual pattern must include not only objects but the spaces between them

definitions.definition: something intended as a guide for making something else
a decorative or artistic work
the path that is prescribed for an airplane that is preparing to land at an airport
examples: the traffic patterns around O'Hare are very crowded
they stayed in the pattern until the fog lifted

definitions.definition: something regarded as a normative example
graphical representation (in polar or Cartesian coordinates) of the spatial distribution of radiation from an antenna as a function of angle
plan or create according to a model or models
a model considered worthy of imitation
examples: the American constitution has provided a pattern for many republics

definitions.definition: form a pattern
examples: These sentences pattern like the ones we studied before

definitions.definition: to become aware of through the senses
examples: I could perceive the ship coming over the horizon

definitions.definition: become conscious of
examples: She finally perceived the futility of her protest

definitions.definition: any state or process known through the senses rather than by intuition or reasoning
a remarkable development
a natural prolongation or projection from a part of an organism either animal or plant
a writ issued by authority of law; usually compels the defendant's attendance in a civil suit; failure to appear results in a default judgment against the defendant
shape, form, or improve a material
deliver a warrant or summons to someone
examples: He was processed by the sheriff

definitions.definition: a sustained phenomenon or one marked by gradual changes through a series of states
examples: the process of calcification begins later for boys than for girls

definitions.definition: institute legal proceedings against; file a suit against
examples: He was warned that the district attorney would process him

definitions.definition: march in a procession
examples: They processed into the dining room

definitions.definition: a particular course of action intended to achieve a result
examples: it was a process of trial and error

definitions.definition: (psychology) the performance of some composite cognitive activity; an operation that affects mental contents
a mental process that you are not directly aware of
subject to a process or treatment, with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition
deal with in a routine way
perform mathematical and logical operations on (data) according to programmed instructions in order to obtain the required information
examples: The results of the elections were still being processed when he gave his acceptance speech

definitions.definition: come to have or undergo a change of (physical features and attributes)
bring out for display
examples: The proud father produced many pictures of his baby

definitions.definition: cause to happen, occur or exist
examples: This procedure produces a curious effect
These chemicals produce a noxious vapor

definitions.definition: fresh fruits and vegetable grown for the market
bring onto the market or release
bring forth or yield
examples: The tree would not produce fruit

definitions.definition: cultivate by growing, often involving improvements by means of agricultural techniques
examples: The Bordeaux region produces great red wines
They produce good ham in Parma

definitions.definition: create or manufacture a man-made product
examples: We produce more cars than we can sell

definitions.definition: all of your experiences that determine how things appear to you
examples: for them demons were as much a part of reality as trees were

definitions.definition: the state of being actual or real
examples: the reality of his situation slowly dawned on him

definitions.definition: the quality possessed by something that is real
the state of the world as it really is rather than as you might want it to be
from appearances alone
examples: the child is seemingly healthy but the doctor is concerned

definitions.definition: a statement that solves a problem or explains how to solve the problem
examples: they were trying to find a peaceful solution

definitions.definition: the set of values that give a true statement when substituted into an equation
a homogeneous mixture of two or more substances; frequently (but not necessarily) a liquid solution
examples: he used a solution of peroxide and water

definitions.definition: a method for solving a problem
examples: the easy solution is to look it up in the handbook

definitions.definition: the successful action of solving a problem
A word placed before nouns to limit or individualize their meaning.
By that; by how much; by so much; on that account; used before comparatives.
examples: the longer we continue in sin, the more difficult it is to reform

definitions.definition: subsequently or soon afterward (often used as sentence connectors)
examples: we watched the late movie and then went to bed

definitions.definition: at a specific prior time
that time; that moment
examples: we were friends from then on

definitions.definition: endowed with the capacity to reason
the process of using your mind to consider something carefully
The preposition to primarily indicates approach and arrival, motion made in the direction of a place or thing and attaining it, access; and also, motion or tendency without arrival; movement toward.
a movement in a new direction
the act of changing or reversing the direction of the course
act of changing in practice or custom
examples: the law took many turnings over the years

definitions.definition: a shaving created when something is produced by turning it on a lathe
the activity of shaping something on a lathe
the end-product created by shaping something on a lathe
to break and turn over earth especially with a plow
examples: turn the earth in the Spring

definitions.definition: twist suddenly so as to sprain
examples: I turned my ankle and couldn't walk for several days

definitions.definition: pass into a condition gradually, take on a specific property or attribute; become
cause to move around a center so as to show another side of
examples: turn a page of a book

definitions.definition: undergo a change or development
let (something) fall or spill from a container
examples: turn the flour onto a plate

definitions.definition: cause (a plastic object) to assume a crooked or angular form
examples: the strong man could turn an iron bar

definitions.definition: undergo a transformation or a change of position or action
examples: We turned from Socialism to Capitalism
The people turned against the President when he stole the election

definitions.definition: pass to the other side of
have recourse to or make an appeal or request for help or information to
examples: She turned to her relatives for help

definitions.definition: turning or twisting around (in place)
a favor for someone
examples: he did me a good turn

definitions.definition: change to the contrary
examples: public opinion turned when it was revealed that the president had an affair with a White House intern

definitions.definition: (game) the activity of doing something in an agreed succession
a short performance that is part of a longer program
a circular segment of a curve
(sports) a division during which one team is on the offensive
a time period for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else)
a movement in a new direction
an unforeseen development
examples: events suddenly took an awkward turn

definitions.definition: the act of changing or reversing the direction of the course
examples: he took a turn to the right

definitions.definition: go sour or spoil
examples: The cream has turned--we have to throw it out

definitions.definition: accomplish by rotating
alter the functioning or setting of
become officially one year older
cause to change or turn into something different;assume new characteristics
examples: The princess turned the frog into a prince by kissing him
The alchemists tried to turn lead into gold

definitions.definition: cause to move along an axis or into a new direction
examples: turn your face to the wall

definitions.definition: cause to move around or rotate
change color
examples: In Vermont, the leaves turn early

definitions.definition: change orientation or direction, also in the abstract sense
examples: The mugger turned and fled before I could see his face
She turned from herself and learned to listen to others' needs

definitions.definition: channel one's attention, interest, thought, or attention toward or away from something
examples: The pedophile turned to boys for satisfaction
people turn to mysticism at the turn of a millennium

definitions.definition: direct at someone
examples: She turned a smile on me
They turned their flashlights on the car

definitions.definition: get by buying and selling
examples: the company turned a good profit after a year

definitions.definition: move around an axis or a center
shape by rotating on a lathe or cutting device or a wheel
examples: turn the legs of the table
turn the clay on the wheel

definitions.definition: taking a short walk out and back
examples: we took a turn in the park

definitions.definition: the act of turning away or in the opposite direction
examples: he made an abrupt turn away from her

definitions.definition: to send or let go
examples: They turned away the crowd at the gate of the governor's mansion

definitions.definition: being one more than one
one of the four playing cards in a deck that have two spots
the cardinal number that is the sum of one and one or a numeral representing this number
lacking a logical or causal relation
not connected by kinship

space for movement

a line leading to a place or point
to a great degree or by a great distance; very much (`right smart' is regional in the United States)
how something is done or how it happens
a general category of things; used in the expression `in the way of'

definitions.definition: a journey or passage
any artifact consisting of a road or path affording passage from one place to another

definitions.definition: a portion of something divided into shares
examples: they split the loot three ways

definitions.definition: doing as one pleases or chooses
the condition of things generally

people in general considered as a whole
all of your experiences that determine how things appear to you
the 3rd planet from the sun; the planet we live on
involving the entire earth; not limited or provincial in scope
the concerns of this life as distinguished from heaven and the afterlife

definitions.definition: everything that exists anywhere
all of the living human inhabitants of the earth

definitions.definition: a part of the earth that can be considered separately
